pullRequest.title: Feat: make automatic system locking for cluster node (CaaSP) user configurable + change CaaSP detection
pullRequest.bodyText:
What does this PR change?
It has been suggested from the field [1] to make the automatic system locking of CaaSP user-configurable. This PR adds a configuration switch to disable the automatic system locking in rhn.conf.
By default, the automatic system locking is enabled.
In addition, we switched how CaaSP gets detected. Even by installing the pattern patterns-caasp-Management (that contains skuba but it will not make a node part of the cluster) it will make the product installed on the node marked as CaaSP. Then, we switched the CaaSP node recognition by looking at the installed pattern: patterns-caasp-Node  installed marks a node as part of a CaaSP cluster.
NOTE: the change above is internal and as such not published into the changelog.
[1] https://mailman.suse.de/mlarch/SuSE/suse-manager/2020/suse-manager.2020.04/msg00285.html
GUI diff
No difference.

 DONE

commit.message: Feat: make automatic system locking for cluster node (CaaSP) user configurable

beforeCommit.message:
Feat: change CaaSP Product detection

We switched how CaaSP gets detected.
Even by installing the pattern `patterns-caasp-Management` (that contains `skuba` but it will not make a node part of the cluster) it will make the product installed on the node marked as CaaSP.
Then, we switched the CaaSP node recognition by looking at the installed pattern: `patterns-caasp-Node`  installed marks a node as part of a CaaSP cluster.

Then, we switched the CaaSP node recognition by looking at the installed pattern: `patterns-caasp-Node`  installed marks a node as part of a CaaSP cluster.
